title-group.article-title: Literary Criticism and Consumer Research: Overview and Illustrative Analysis

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1989 The Journal of Consumer Research, Inc.

abstract.p: This article proposes literary criticism as a source of insight into consumer behavior, presents a broad overview of literary criticism, provides a specific illustrative analysis, and offers suggestions for further research. Literary analysis of advertising text reveals elements that provide additional information to consumer researchers, and contributions of literary criticism to consumer research are discussed. Major post-war critical schools are reviewed, and relevant theoretical concepts summarized. An ad for Ivory Flakes is analyzed using a variety of concepts drawn from literary schools, primarily sociocultural and reader-response ones. Suggestions for additional research on content analysis, image analysis, and the history of consumption are made.

p.mixed-citation: Advertising Age, "The House that Ivory Built: 150 Years of Procter & Gamble," August 20, 1987, p. 46.August 20 46 Advertising Age 1987
